Package player_act

Class Actor

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.image.ImageView
player_act.Actor
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
Direct Known Subclasses:
BackgroundImage, Digit, End, layout, Log, Player, Turtle, vehicles, WetTurtle
public abstract class Actor
extends javafx.scene.image.ImageView
This abstract class is used to define all objects in the game

  • Method Details

    • move

      public void move​(double dx, double dy)
      This method is used to move the object a number of pixels in the x direction and a number of pixels in the y direction
      Parameters:
      dx - how many pixels to move in the x direction
      dy - how many pixels to move in the y direction

    • getWorld

      public World getWorld()
      fetches the parent object, which is the stage
      Returns:
      the parent node, the root node

    • getIntersectingObjects

      public <A extends Actor> java.util.List<A> getIntersectingObjects​(java.lang.Class<A> cls)
      Method to check intersection between objects
      Type Parameters:
      A - an empty arraylist
      Parameters:
      cls - The object to check intersections with
      Returns:
      an array containing all actors that are intersecting

    • getOneIntersectingObject

      public <A extends Actor> A getOneIntersectingObject​(java.lang.Class<A> cls)

    • act

      public void act​(long now)
      A call to the encapsulated method act
      Parameters:
      now - game timer

    • getType

      public java.lang.String getType()
      types of actors such as turtle or log, used for placement functions
      Returns:
      the type of actor
      See Also:
      World.checknextfree(String)
